intro: Centropogon floccosus, commonly known as the woolly centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
